results.title: Case Report: High efficacy of low-dose flecainide as an add-on therapy to a beta-blocker for treating a high burden of idiopathic ventricular arrhythmias in a juvenile athlete.
results.text_hl: Initiation of treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 12.5 mg twice a day led to inadequate reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@PVCs@@@, with 29,452 isolated monomorphic @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@PVCs@@@ (PVC burden: 29%) still observed on 24-h ambulatory electrocardiographic monitoring.

citations.NLM: Christou GA, Letsas KP, Konstandi M, Christou MA, Christou KA, Kyriakopoulos C, Vidalakis E, Tigas S, Christodoulou DK, Kiortsis DN. Case Report: High efficacy of low-dose flecainide as an add-on therapy to a beta-blocker for treating a high burden of idiopathic ventricular arrhythmias in a juvenile athlete. Front Cardiovasc Med. 2025;12():1537078. PMID: 40384969
citations.BibTeX: @article{40384969, title={Case Report: High efficacy of low-dose flecainide as an add-on therapy to a beta-blocker for treating a high burden of idiopathic ventricular arrhythmias in a juvenile athlete.}, author={Christou GA and Letsas KP and Konstandi M and Christou MA and Christou KA and Kyriakopoulos C and Vidalakis E and Tigas S and Christodoulou DK and Kiortsis DN}, journal={Front Cardiovasc Med}, volume={12}, pages={1537078}}

results.title: Arrhythmogenic mechanisms of acute obstructive respiratory events in a porcine model of drug-induced long QT.
results.text_hl: Administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ prevented post-INAP EMW shortening and decreased occurrence of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@PVCs@@@.

citations.NLM: Linz B, Sattler SM, Flethøj M, Høtbjerg Hansen ME, Hesselkilde EM, Saljic A, Wirth K, Linz D, Tfelt-Hansen J, Jespersen T. Arrhythmogenic mechanisms of acute obstructive respiratory events in a porcine model of drug-induced long QT. Heart Rhythm. 2021 Aug;18(8):1384-1391. PMID: 33722764
citations.BibTeX: @article{33722764, title={Arrhythmogenic mechanisms of acute obstructive respiratory events in a porcine model of drug-induced long QT.}, author={Linz B and Sattler SM and Flethøj M and Høtbjerg Hansen ME and Hesselkilde EM and Saljic A and Wirth K and Linz D and Tfelt-Hansen J and Jespersen T}, journal={Heart Rhythm}, volume={18}, number={8}, pages={1384-1391}}

results.title: Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by atenolol.
results.text_hl: A therapeutic response, defined as the minimum percentage reduction in @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@ to demonstrate an effect due to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ rather than spontaneous variation, was achieved in up to 70% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ for total number of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ectopic beats@@@, 75% for ectopic couplets, and 73% for @DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ beats.

citations.NLM: Heng MK, Zimmer I. Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by atenolol. Am Heart J. 1985 Jun;109(6):1273-80. PMID: 4003239
citations.BibTeX: @article{4003239, title={Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by atenolol.}, author={Heng MK and Zimmer I}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={109}, number={6}, pages={1273-80}}

results.title: [Atenolol in the treatment of premature ventricular contractions. A double blind study in 68 patients (author's transl)].
results.text_hl: [@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@premature ventricular contractions@@@.

citations.NLM: Körst HA, Brandes JW, Lembcke HJ, Littmann KP. [Atenolol in the treatment of premature ventricular contractions. A double blind study in 68 patients (author's transl)]. Z Kardiol. 1981 May;70(5):419-24. PMID: 6168124

results.title: Mexiletine and disopyramide suppress ventricular premature contractions (VPC) irrespective of the relationship between the VPC and the underlying heart rate.
results.text_hl: The findings strikingly contrasted those obtained with @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, which predominantly suppressed @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@VPCs@@@ of the positive type which share similar characteristics with a triggered activity in vitro.

citations.NLM: Saikawa T, Nakagawa M, Takahashi N, Ishida S, Fujino T, Ito M, Shimoyama N, Hara M, Yonemochi H, Maeda T. Mexiletine and disopyramide suppress ventricular premature contractions (VPC) irrespective of the relationship between the VPC and the underlying heart rate. Jpn Heart J. 1992 Sep;33(5):665-78. PMID: 1283888

results.title: Suppression of ventricular premature contractions possibly related to triggered activity by oral diltiazem and atenolol.
results.text_hl: Suppression of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ventricular premature contractions@@@ possibly related to triggered activity by oral @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Ito M, Tsumabuki S, Maeda Y, Arita M, Saikawa T, Ito S, Fujino T, Fukumoto T, Yamada K, Kikuchi Y. Suppression of ventricular premature contractions possibly related to triggered activity by oral diltiazem and atenolol. Jpn Circ J. 1987 Feb;51(2):217-29. PMID: 2439719

results.title: Suppression of ventricular premature contractions continues after the washout of antiarrhythmic drugs.
results.text_hl: Holter monitoring was repeated before, during and after the treatment with the above 3 drugs and the efficacies of the drugs were evaluated based on the spontaneous variability before the treatment. @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@VPC@@@ reduction exceeding the calculated spontaneous variability during drugs therapy (drug-responders) and after the washout of the drugs (wash-responders) was noted in 17 (63%) and 3 (13%) of the @CHEMICAL_Mexiletine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008801 @@@mexiletine@@@ group; 11 (58%) and 5 (26%) of the @CHEMICAL_Disopyramide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004206 @@@disopyramide@@@ group; and 13 (59%) and 8 (36%) of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group, respectively.

citations.NLM: Saikawa T, Ito M, Nakagawa M, Shimoyama N, Hara M, Yonemochi H, Maeda T, Inoue T, Takaki R, Arita M. Suppression of ventricular premature contractions continues after the washout of antiarrhythmic drugs. Jpn Circ J. 1993 Jan;57(1):55-62. PMID: 8437342
citations.BibTeX: @article{8437342, title={Suppression of ventricular premature contractions continues after the washout of antiarrhythmic drugs.}, author={Saikawa T and Ito M and Nakagawa M and Shimoyama N and Hara M and Yonemochi H and Maeda T and Inoue T and Takaki R and Arita M}, journal={Jpn Circ J}, volume={57}, number={1}, pages={55-62}}

results.title: Atenolol for ventricular ectopy: a dose-response study.
results.text_hl: The antiarrhythmic efficacy, safety, and tolerance of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was evaluated in 32 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with an average of at least 60 @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ventricular ectopic depolarizations@@@/hr.

citations.NLM: Fenster PE, Reynolds D, Horwitz LD, Morrison D, Goldman S, Thadani U, Lazzara R, Serokman R, Marcus FI. Atenolol for ventricular ectopy: a dose-response study. Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1987 Jan;41(1):118-23. PMID: 3802701
citations.BibTeX: @article{3802701, title={Atenolol for ventricular ectopy: a dose-response study.}, author={Fenster PE and Reynolds D and Horwitz LD and Morrison D and Goldman S and Thadani U and Lazzara R and Serokman R and Marcus FI}, journal={Clin Pharmacol Ther}, volume={41}, number={1}, pages={118-23}}

results.title: Intravenous atenolol for ventricular arrhythmias.
results.text_hl: Thus, a single intravenous dose of 10 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ can significantly reduce the frequency of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Premature_Complexes</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018879 @@@ventricular premature complexes@@@ and @DISEASE_Tachycardia_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017180 @@@ventricular tachycardia@@@ within the first hour after infusion; suppression can last for 7 hours.

citations.NLM: Morganroth J. Intravenous atenolol for ventricular arrhythmias. Am J Cardiol. 1986 Sep 1;58(6):499-502. PMID: 3529912
